response_dict_list.question: What makes Sam Altman a good founder?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: He has a great force of will.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Sam Altman is considered a good founder because he is someone who can be trusted.
retrieved_context: If they know they can't fire the founders, they'll have to choose founders they can trust.And that's who they should have been choosing all along.Thanks to Sam Altman, John Bautista, Trevor Blackwell, Paul Buchheit, Brian Chesky, Bill Clerico, Patrick Collison, Adam Goldstein, James Lindenbaum, Jessica Livingston, and Fred Wilson for reading drafts of this.

response_dict_list.question: When was the essay "Five Founders" written?
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The essay "Five Founders" was written in April 2009.
retrieved_context:
Five Founders

April 2009

Inc recently asked me who I thought were the 5 most interesting startup founders of the last 30 years.How do you decide who's the most interesting?The best test seemed to be influence: who are the 5 who've influenced me most?Who do I use as examples when I'm talking to companies we fund?Who do I find myself quoting?1.Steve JobsI'd guess Steve is the most influential founder not just for me but for most people you could ask.A lot of startup culture is Apple culture.He was the original young founder.

response_dict_list.question: When does the most dramatic growth happen for a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: When the startup only has three or four people.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The most dramatic growth for a startup happens when it only has three or four people.
retrieved_context: The really dramatic growth happens when a startup only has three or four people, so only three or four people see that, whereas tens of thousands see business as it's practiced by Boeing or Philip Morris.This book can help fix that problem, by showing everyone what, till now, only a handful people got to see: what happens in the first year of a startup.This is what real productivity looks like.This is the Formula 1 racecar.It looks weird, but it goes fast.Of course, big companies won't be able to do everything these startups do.

response_dict_list.question: What is the problem with business culture versus start up culture with respect to productivity?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: In business culture, energy is expended on outward appearance to the detriment of productivity, while in startup culture there is no value of appearance it's all about productivity.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The problem with business culture versus start-up culture with respect to productivity is that business culture tends to prioritize appearances and image over actual performance. In business culture, there is often a focus on looking impressive and conforming to traditional norms, such as dressing in suits and holding formal meetings. This can lead to a significant amount of energy being expended on maintaining appearances rather than on actual productive work. In contrast, start-up culture values efficiency and results over appearances. Start-ups are often more focused on getting things done quickly and efficiently, which can lead to higher levels of productivity.
retrieved_context: If you looked in people's heads (or stock photo collections) for images representing "business," you'd get images of people dressed up in suits, groups sitting around conference tables looking serious, Powerpoint presentations, people producing thick reports for one another to read.Early stage startups are the exact opposite of this.And yet they're probably the most productive part of the whole economy.Why the disconnect?I think there's a general principle at work here: the less energy people expend on performance, the more they expend on appearances to compensate.More often than not the energy they expend on seeming impressive makes their actual performance worse.

response_dict_list.question: What's the single biggest thing the government could do to increase the number of startups in this country?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Establish a new class of visa for startup founders.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Establish a new class of visa for startup founders.
retrieved_context:
The Founder Visa

April 2009

I usually avoid politics, but since we now seem to have an administration that's open to suggestions, I'm going to risk making one.The single biggest thing the government could do to increase the number of startups in this country is a policy that would cost nothing: establish a new class of visa for startup founders.The biggest constraint on the number of new startups that get created in the US is not tax policy or employment law or even Sarbanes-Oxley.It's that we won't let the people who want to start them into the country.

response_dict_list.question: How could one create a rigorous government definition of what a startup is to categorize whether a business is a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: One could define a startup as a company that has received investment by recognized startup investors. An accreditation procedure would be determined to establish recognized startup investors.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The government could create a rigorous definition of what a startup is by using the expertise of recognized startup investors. These investors already work hard to identify the best startups, so the government could piggyback on their knowledge and use their investment decisions as a test for determining whether a company qualifies as a startup. This approach would allow the market to decide which businesses meet the criteria of being a startup, similar to how the government determines what counts as a university for student visas.
retrieved_context: In fact they'd cause there to be more jobs for Americans, because the companies they started would hire more employees as they grew.The tricky part might seem to be how one defined a startup.But that could be solved quite easily: let the market decide.Startup investors work hard to find the best startups.The government could not do better than to piggyback on their expertise, and use investment by recognized startup investors as the test of whether a company was a real startup.How would the government decide who's a startup investor?The same way they decide what counts as a university for student visas.

response_dict_list.question: Why is frienship a good quality of founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because building a startup is tough and without a strong friendship building the startup will tear the founders apart.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because it helps to establish a strong relationship between them. When founders genuinely like one another and work well together, it creates a positive and harmonious working environment. This strong bond allows them to understand each other's thoughts and perspectives, leading to effective communication and collaboration. Additionally, friendship can help founders navigate through disagreements and conflicts in a healthy manner, ensuring that any tensions are resolved quickly and efficiently.
retrieved_context: Most of the big successes have two or three.And the relationship between the founders has to be strong.They must genuinely like one another, and work well together.Startups do to the relationship between the founders what a dog does to a sock: if it can be pulled apart, it will be.Emmett Shear and Justin Kan of Justin.tv are a good example of close friends who work well together.They've known each other since second grade.They can practically read one another's minds.I'm sure they argue, like all founders, but I have never once sensed any unresolved tension between them.

response_dict_list.question: Why is determination the most important quality in startup founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Because when building a startup you're going to hit a lot of obstacles, and determination will prevent one from getting demoralized by the constant obstacles.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Determination is considered the most important quality in startup founders because it has been found to be more crucial than intelligence. While intelligence is still valued, determination is seen as essential for overcoming the challenges and obstacles that arise in the startup journey. It is the driving force that keeps founders motivated and resilient in the face of setbacks and failures.
retrieved_context:
What We Look for in Founders

October 2010

Want to start a startup?Get funded by Y Combinator.(I wrote this for Forbes, who asked me to write something about the qualities we look for in founders.In print they had to cut the last item because they didn't have room.)1.DeterminationThis has turned out to be the most important quality in startup founders.We thought when we started Y Combinator that the most important quality would be intelligence.That's the myth in the Valley.And certainly you don't want founders to be stupid.

response_dict_list.question: For startups, what does board control mean in practice?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: During board meetings, matters are decided in the discussion preceding the vote, not in the vote itself, which is usually unanimous. If opinion is divided in such discussions, the side that knows it would lose in a vote tends to be less insistent. This is what board control means in practice.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Board control for startups means having a majority of board seats, which allows the founders or majority shareholders to have a significant influence over decision-making processes. While it does not grant total control, it does give them the ability to shape the direction of the company and make decisions that align with their vision and interests. This level of control can have a significant impact on the overall dynamics and culture within the startup.
retrieved_context: You don't simply get to do whatever you want; the board still has to act in the interest of the shareholders; but if you have a majority of board seats, then your opinion about what's in the interest of the shareholders will tend to prevail.So while board control is not total control, it's not imaginary either.There's inevitably a difference in how things feel within the company.Which means if it becomes the norm for founders to retain board control after a series A, that will change the way things feel in the whole startup world.

response_dict_list.question: What's in the way of founders keeping board control after a series A?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: The perception that founders keeping board control after a series A being a concession a VC has made when negotiating with startups. VCs do not want to look like they've lost a negotiation. If founders keeping control after a series A is the norm, then it happening will not look like the VCs lost the negotiation.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: VCs are often in the way of founders keeping board control after a series A.
retrieved_context:
Founder Control

December 2010

Want to start a startup?Get funded by Y Combinator.Someone we funded is talking to VCs now, and asked me how common it was for a startup's founders to retain control of the board after a series A round.He said VCs told him this almost never happened.Ten years ago that was true.In the past, founders rarely kept control of the board through a series A.The traditional series A board consisted of two founders, two VCs, and one independent member.More recently the recipe is often one founder, one VC, and one independent.
